questions.question: Who were the first people to live in Canada?
questions.explanation: Indigenous peoples (First Nations, Inuit, and MÃ©tis) were the first people to live in Canada, arriving thousands of years before European explorers.

questions.question: When did the first European explorers reach Canada?
questions.explanation: The Vikings were the first Europeans to reach Canada, establishing a settlement in L'Anse aux Meadows in Newfoundland around 1000 CE.

questions.question: Who was the first European to map Canada's Atlantic coast?
questions.explanation: Jacques Cartier made three voyages to Canada between 1534 and 1542, exploring and mapping the Gulf of St. Lawrence and the St. Lawrence River.

questions.question: When did Canada become a country with its own constitution?
questions.explanation: The British North America Act (now known as the Constitution Act, 1867) created the Dominion of Canada on July 1, 1867.

questions.question: Which province was the first to grant women the right to vote in provincial elections?
questions.explanation: Manitoba was the first province to grant women the right to vote in provincial elections in 1916.
